item.title: My Jupyter Notebook Post
item.description: import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt # Create the x-axis and y-axis values x = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] y = [2, 4, 1, 3, 5] # Plot the points plt.plot(x, y) # Add a title to the graph plt.title('My First Graph') # Add labels to the x-axis and y-axis plt.xlabel('x-axis') plt.ylabel('y-axis') # Show the graph plt.show()

item.title: Net Profit Forecasting
item.description: Overview: This notebook aimed is to demonstrate the solution for simple regression problem, predict net profit given a set of attributes, first I start with simple EDA understand the data numerical and categorical distributions. Then I fit simple statistical model followed by linear regression and more complex one. each model includes scoring metrics and explanations. Finally, I communicate final finding of prediction of the provided Out-of-sample test set and the including factors or attributes that decided the final predictions using shapley values.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.
